oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-09 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 9, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Ford Rush, Zeke Clements, and Oscar Stone and his Possum Hunters. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Ford Rush; Zeke Clements; Oscar Stone; Possum Hunters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Good Old Mountain Dew (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay talks -- Darling Nelly Gray (Ford Rush) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone, George D. Hay) -- Sourwood Mountain (cast) -- George D. Hay introduces Zeke Clements -- There's A Love Knot In My Lariat (Zeke Clements) -- George D. Hay introduces Oscar Stone and his Possum Hunters -- How Many Biscuits Can You Eat (Oscar Stone and his Possum Hunters)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Bailey, DeFord; Stone, Oscar, 1881-; Possum Hunters (Musical group); Clements, Zeke; McGar, Mac
